headline: The Trump Administration Shut a Vaccine Safety Office Last Year. What’s the Plan Now?
snippet: Experts say plans to track coronavirus vaccines in the U.S. are fragmented: “We don’t even know who’s in charge.”
abstract: The office was dedicated to the long-term safety of vaccines. Experts say plans to track coronavirus vaccines are fragmented and “behind the eight ball.”

headline: Trump’s Antibody ‘Cure’ Will Be in Short Supply
snippet: All the weak points of American health care — testing delays, communication breakdowns and inequity — are working against this potential treatment.
abstract: All the weak points of American health care — testing delays, communication breakdowns, inequity — are working against this potential treatment.

headline: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
snippet: What the near future may hold
abstract: What the near future may hold

headline: A Dose of Optimism, as the Pandemic Rages On
snippet: The months ahead will be difficult. But the medical cavalry is coming, and the rest of us know what we need to do.
abstract: The months ahead will be difficult. But the medical cavalry is coming, and the rest of us know what we need to do.

headline: First, a Vaccine Approval. Then ‘Chaos and Confusion.’
snippet: Come spring, Americans may have their choice of several so-so coronavirus vaccines — with no way of knowing which one is best.
abstract: Come spring, Americans may have their choice of several so-so coronavirus vaccines — with no way of knowing which one is best.

headline: Trump’s Covid Treatments Were Tested in Cells Derived From Fetal Tissue
snippet: The antibody cocktail that President Trump had called a “cure” was developed using a practice his administration had moved to restrict.
abstract: The “cell lines” used to develop monoclonal antibodies, as well as remdesivir and vaccines, began with fetal tissue decades ago.
byline: By Apoorva Mandavilli and Nathalia Holt

headline: Regeneron Asks F.D.A. for Emergency Approval for Drug That Trump Claimed Cured Him
snippet: The company said that doses of the unproven treatment would be available for 50,000 patients. It’s impossible to know whether it helped the president.
abstract: The company said that doses of the unproven treatment would be available for 50,000 patients. It’s impossible to know whether it helped the president.

headline: Trump Calls His Illness ‘a Blessing From God’
snippet: President Trump called his infection a “blessing from God,” as he tried to play down a pandemic that has killed over 211,000 Americans.
abstract: In a video on Wednesday evening, the president portrayed an unproven antibody cocktail being developed by the drug maker Regeneron as a miracle cure.
byline: By Maggie Haberman and Katie Thomas

headline: ‘I think this was a blessing from God that I caught it,’ Trump says of the virus in a new video.
byline: By Maggie Haberman and Katie Thomas

headline: A senior vaccine scientist who blew the whistle on political interference resigns.
U.S. Says Virus Can’t Be Controlled. China Aims to Prove It Wrong.
snippet: China’s approach to keep Covid-19 at bay has helped restore confidence and allowed businesses to reopen. But it is a strategy steeped in authoritarianism.
abstract: China’s approach to keep Covid-19 at bay has helped restore confidence and allowed businesses to reopen. But it is a strategy steeped in authoritarianism.

headline: How Trump and Bolsonaro Broke Latin America’s Covid-19 Defenses
snippet: The two presidents drove out 10,000 Cuban doctors and nurses. They defunded the region’s leading health agency. They wrongly pushed hydroxychloroquine as a cure.
abstract: The two presidents drove out 10,000 Cuban doctors and nurses. They defunded the region’s leading health agency. They wrongly pushed hydroxychloroquine as a cure.
byline: By David D. Kirkpatrick and José María León Cabrera

headline: America and the Virus: ‘A Colossal Failure of Leadership’
snippet: In its destruction of American lives, treasure and well-being, this pandemic marks the greatest failure of U.S. governance since Vietnam.
abstract: In its destruction of American lives, treasure and well-being, this pandemic marks the greatest failure of U.S. governance since Vietnam.

headline: What Fans of ‘Herd Immunity’ Don’t Tell You
snippet: A proposal to let people with low risk of infection live without constraint could lead to a million or more preventable deaths.
abstract: A proposal to let people with low risk of infection live without constraint could lead to a million or more preventable deaths.

headline: White House Blocked C.D.C. From Requiring Masks on Public Transportation
snippet: The order would have mandated that both passengers and employees wear face coverings on planes, trains, buses and subways and in airports, stations and depots.
abstract: The order would have mandated that both passengers and employees wear face coverings on planes, trains, buses and subways and in airports, stations and depots.

headline: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
snippet: The coronavirus treatment President Trump praised as his “cure” was created using a cell line derived from an aborted fetus.
abstract: The coronavirus treatment President Trump praised as his “cure” was created using a cell line derived from an aborted fetus.

headline: Trump May Have Covid, but Many of His Supporters Still Scoff at Masks
snippet: They echo misinformation that the president has spread for much of the year, as he has sought to minimize the threat of the virus.
abstract: They echo misinformation that the president has spread for much of the year, as he has sought to minimize the threat of the virus.

headline: Trump Tests Positive for Coronavirus, and the World Shudders
snippet: The news of an American president contracting a potentially lethal virus carried global repercussions beyond that of any other world leader.
abstract: The news of an American president contracting a potentially lethal virus carried global repercussions beyond that of any other world leader.
